business.headline: Zomato's Deepinder Goyal to return unvested ESOPs as he steps down as Eternal CEOAccording to Goyal, the move strengthens long-term employee retention without adding to shareholder dilution, something that is often a concern during leadership changes.
Sensex ends 398 points higher, Nifty above 25,400; BEL up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 397.74 points to close at 82,307.37, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 132.40 points to end at 25,289.90.

India's banking system is resilient and prepared for global shocks: SBI ChairmanSetty said a key difference between India and many other economies today is the strength of its banking system. He recalled that after the global financial crisis and the subsequent spillovers, India undertook one of the largest clean-ups of bank balance sheets through asset quality reviews and recapitalisation.

India's growth story strong on AI and trade deals, says Tech Mahindra CEOAccording to Mohit Joshi, India's strength lies in execution, i.e., taking complex technologies and applying them at scale across large organisations.

Air India braces for roughly Rs 15,000 crore loss after deadly crash: ReportAir India is expected to post a loss of at least Rs 15,000 crore (about $1.6 billion) for the financial year ending March 31, said the people, who requested anonymity because the information is private.

8th Pay Commission: Pay revision, pension changes and fiscal impact explainedWith the 8th Pay Commission in focus, expectations are building around changes to pay and pensions for government employees. How might these revisions impact public spending, consumption and long-term fiscal health? Let's have a look.

Shadowfax Technologies IPO enters final day: Price band, GMP and should you apply?The allotment is expected to be finalised on 23 January 2026. Shares are likely to list on both the BSE and NSE on 28 January 2026, subject to market conditions.

Rupee slides to record levels. What the fall means for your daily expensesThe rupee's fall may look like a market story, but its ripple effects travel much further. What happens next could shape prices, travel costs and your monthly budget.

Budget 2026: Agri industry seeks stronger push for sustainability, nutrition and R&DAs India gears up for Union Budget 2026, voices from the agriculture sector are calling for policies that go beyond short-term gains and focus on sustainable farming, food security, better nutrition and stronger support for research and development.

Gold and silver keep soaring to record highs, but is it a boom or a bubble?In 2025, gold delivered its strongest annual gains in nearly 50 years, while silver posted its best returns ever. That strength carried into 2026, with silver crossing the Rs 3,00,000 per kg mark in India.

Tariffs or no tariffs, here's why global CEOs are betting big on IndiaIndia's rise in CEO rankings reflects a simple reality. Global companies want growth, scale and stability, and the numbers show India is delivering more of it than most major markets right now.

Sensex, Nifty rebound as global cues improve: Is the worst finally over?The rebound in Sensex and Nifty may not guarantee stability, but Thursday's sharp turnaround shows the benchmarks are finally finding their footing after weeks of relentless selling.

Sensex jumps over 700 points: Why is the stock market rising todayAs of 9:46 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 785.92 points at 82,695.55. The NSE Nifty50 climbed 251.60 points to 25,409.10. The strong opening showed that investors were willing to take fresh positions after recent uncertainty.
Sensex, Nifty rally over positive global cues, hopes of India-US trade dealThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 760.64 points to 82,670.27, while the NSE Nifty added 246.10 points to 25,403.60 as of 9:40 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Stock market likely to open higher. Here's whyGIFT Nifty futures were trading at 25,338 at around 8:09 AM. This points to a positive opening for the Nifty 50, which closed at 25,157.50 on Wednesday.

Movie isn't over: Gita Gopinath on Trump tariffs and Carney's speechGita Gopinath, Indian-American economist and Professor of Economics at Harvard University, shares her insights on Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney's remarks on shifting global economic order during the World Economic Forum in Davos and dealing with tariffs.

Pollution a bigger economic threat than tariffs for India, says Gita GopinathGopinath said discussions about new business development often focus on trade, tariffs and regulations, but pollution is rarely given the importance it deserves.

WEF Roundtable: Can India become the third-largest economy? Experts weigh inAt World Economic Forum (WEF) Roundtable in Davos, India Today Group Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief Kalli Purie moderated a session on India's growth story.

India has emerged as trusted value chain partner to the world: Ashwini VaishnawUnion Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said the biggest change over the last decade has been how the world views India's role in global manufacturing.

Can India become the world's third-largest economy?At Davos, a session moderated by India Today Group Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief Kalli Purie brought together leading economist Gita Gopinath, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, Bharti Chairman Sunil Bharti Mittal, and IKEA Group CEO Juvencio Maeztu Herrera to decode India's journey towards becoming the world's third-largest economy.

entertainment.headline: Palash Muchhal accused of cheating Sangli man of Rs 40 lakh; complaint filed Palaash Muchhal is embroiled in fresh controversy following the cancellation of his wedding to Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana. A complaint has been filed against him in Sangli, accusing him of cheating a local man of Rs 40 lakh in a failed film investment deal.

Border 2, like Dhurandhar, banned in Gulf countries over India-Pakistan theme Border 2, set for release tomorrow, has been banned in Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, and the UAE over its perceived 'anti-Pakistan' themes. The move followed recent trends with similar Indian films based on patriotic themes in the region.

Rajamouli calls Priyanka Chopra unstoppable after The Bluff trailer Filmmaker SS Rajamouli commended Priyanka Chopra for her role in the upcoming action film The Bluff, set to debut on Prime Video on February 25. He shared the note on X.

Varun Dhawan: Border 2 pushed me to my limits and changed me Varun Dhawan shared an emotional note ahead of the release of Border 2. The film also features Sunny Deol, Diljit Dosanjh, Ahan Shetty, Mona Singh, Medha Rana, Sonam Bajwa and Anya Singh in key roles.

2016 Bollywood dump: The Khans, Pink, and the year Hindi cinema grew up As social media revisits 2016, we look back at a defining year for Bollywood. The Khans dominated, sports dramas broke rules, Pink changed conversations, and Hindi cinema found its conscience.

Proud mother Kareena, doting father Saif root for son Jeh on annual day. Video Bollywood actors Kareena Kapoor Khan and Saif Ali Khan attended the Junior School Annual Day at Dhirubhai Ambani International School, where they openly supported their son Jeh during his on-stage performance. A heartwarming video of the event went viral online.

Who are you? Bipasha Basu snaps at paps while shielding daughter Devi During a recent outing in Bandra, actor Bipasha Basu snapped at paparazzi who attempted to take pictures of her daughter Devi.

Mahesh Babu, children shower Namrata Shirodkar with love on her 54th birthday Actor Mahesh Babu, his children and Namrata Shirodkar's sister Shilpa Shirodkar sent birthday wishes to Namrata as she turned 54. Babu had the sweetest wish, calling her the strength of the family.

Chole bhature, volleyball, romance: Anushka-Virat's chemistry in new ad is pure joy Virat Kohli and actor Anushka Sharma feature in a new Dubai tourism ad, surprising each other with food and activities while showcasing their chemistry. The campaign highlights the couple's playful side as they explore Dubai together.

I wrote it in 2013: Raat Akeli Hai writer on Knives Out comparisons Writer Smita Singh discussed the origins of her script for Raat Akeli Hai, its perceived similarities to Knives Out, and her decision to step away from the murder mystery genre after the upcoming sequel.

James Cameron opens up on leaving the US and settling in New Zealand James Cameron says New Zealand's handling of the COVID-19 pandemic and its unified approach to science motivated his family's permanent move in 2020, highlighting contrasts with the United States.

BTS' Arirang is first album to debut at number 1 on Spotify global chart BTS's upcoming album Arirang has achieved record-breaking pre-save numbers on Spotify, surpassing 2 million within four days and maintaining a strong lead on global charts.

Anurag Thakur on playing Madanlal Pahwa who tried to kill Gandhi: Didn't judge him Actor Anurag Thakur essays the role of Madanlal Pahwa in Freedom At Midnight Season 2. The portrayal delves into complex emotions behind a controversial historical figure.

Border 2 vs Gadar 2 advance booking: How Sunny Deol new sequel stacks up Border 2 is enjoying significant advance bookings, though its opening pre-sale figures are lower than those seen for last year's Gadar 2.

Absolute fire: Nayanthara hypes Rani Mukerji's Mardaani 3 trailer The trailer for Mardaani 3, starring Rani Mukerji as police officer Shivani Shivaji Roy, has drawn praise from stars and fans alike ahead of its 30 January 2026 release. Actress Nayanthara and viewers have highlighted the trailer's impactful and emotional themes.

Biggest stars are Salman Khan, SRK: Manoj Muntashir rejects AR Rahman's claims Lyricist Manoj Muntashir contradicted composer AR Rahman's recent remarks on discrimination and communal politics in Bollywood. He underscored the industry's ongoing record of inclusivity and pointed to recent box office hits as supporting evidence.

Vijay's Jana Nayagan misses Republic Day week, makers now eye February release Jana Nayagan's theatrical release is delayed due to a pending legal dispute with the CBFC. The film's makers now aim for a February release to avoid election-related screening restrictions.

Afghan cricketer Rashid Khan vows to watch Border 2, Varun Dhawan reacts Afghanistan cricket captain Rashid Khan shared a social media reel expressing excitement for the upcoming film Border 2, sparking reactions from the film's cast members Varun Dhawan and Ahan Shetty, besides Suniel Shetty from the original film.

general news.headline: Won't play in India: Bangladesh boycott T20 World Cup, ICC to name replacementThe Bangladesh Cricket Board on Thursday remained firm in its stance, saying it won't play in India. The ICC, on Wednesday, rejected Bangladesh's request to change the venues, dismissing concerns of security threat for Bangladesh players in India.

Will settle another war: Trump unveils Board of Peace for Gaza with 35 nationsUS President Donald Trump launched a new peace initiative at Davos, warning Hamas to disarm or face severe consequences. The Board of Peace aims to oversee ceasefire and reconstruction efforts in Gaza while fostering broader international cooperation.

India office, Pak crypto deal: How Trump made Rs 12,800 crore in 2nd termDonald Trump, speaking in Davos, boasted that he was making America great and rich again. However, the US President seems to be pursuing a 'Make Trump Richer' agenda. According to an NYT report, the real estate mogul amassed around $1.4 billion since taking office a year ago.

Plate policing: Trinamool slams Centre over veg menu on Bengal-Assam Vande BharatIn response to fish and meat being removed from the menu, Indian Railways said, "We have decided not to include non-vegetarian items because the train connects two auspicious places - Maa Kamakhya Temple and Maa Kali Temple." An emotive issue for Bengalis, the move quickly became political fodder, with the Trinamool Congress seizing on it.

The million-dollar Vantara-inspired watch made for Anant AmbaniAnant Ambani is known to be a custodian of luxury, limited-edition watches. And now, one brand has decided to give his venture, Vantara, an ode in the most horological way ever.

Return of dog-walker IAS officer to Delhi shows government respects latentIAS officer Sanjeev Khirwar, who was transferred to Ladakh after a dog-walking controversy, is back in the capital as MCD Commissioner. One of the key tasks that the dog-stroller babu will get is to deal with Delhi's street-dog problem. This could be a template for bureaucrats with special talents.

Australia shooting was domestic attack, shooter killed ex-girlfriend, 2 othersThe shooting in Australia's New South Wales state happened on the same day Australia observed a National Day of Mourning for the victims of the Bondi Beach terror attack.

How governors are trying to steal the Opposition's scriptKarnataka Governor Thaawarchand Gehlot staged a walkout from the Assembly on Thursday. It was the second instance in three days that a governor staged a walkout. Before Gehlot, RN Ravi, the governor of Tamil Nadu omitted parts of his speech and walked out of the Assembly. Walkout, a weapon of the Opposition, is now being appropriated by governors.

Sahara turns white: Why is it snowing in the desert?Rare snowfall has transformed the golden dunes of northern Algeria into a stunning winter landscape. Cold air from Europe collided with Mediterranean moisture to create this extraordinary desert phenomenon.

10 Army personnel killed after vehicle plunges into 200-foot gorge in J&KOfficials said the Army vehicle was heading towards a high-altitude post when its driver lost control and the vehicle plunged into a 200-foot-deep gorge. Initially, four soldiers were found dead, and now the toll has increased to 10.
Caught on camera: Train rams truck at Jharkhand railway crossingA train collided with a truck at a railway crossing in Gujarat, narrowly avoiding a major accident with no casualties reported.

Mumbai to get woman mayor, Uddhav Sena objects, walks out amid lottery pickAs per the reservation, the mayoral posts in Pune, Dhule, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), Nanded, Navi Mumbai, Malegaon, Mira Bhayandar, Nashik and Nagpur have been reserved for women.

Reality check in Greater Noida exposes danger spots after techie's deathAfter Noida techie Yuvraj's death, India Today does a reality check at multiple locations in Greater Noida. This is how the report exposes the dangerous spots that can turn fatal for commuters any day or any night. Read the report here...

India condemns vandalism of national flag by Khalistanis at embassy in CroatiaIndia has strongly condemned the trespassing and vandalism at its Embassy in Zagreb, calling it a serious breach of international law. The Ministry of External Affairs has urged Croatian authorities to take strict action against the perpetrators involved in this anti-India act.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 16 | Vaishnavism: The Ultimate Synthesis & Poetic PeakIf the Saivite revival was the fierce, indigenous gust that broke the cold austerity of Jain-Buddhist asceticism, the Vaishnavite tradition was the gentle, yet profound force that perfected the shift.

A complaint has been filed against him in Sangli, accusing him of cheating a local man of Rs 40 lakh in a failed film investment deal.

Top Maoist leader with Rs 1 crore bounty among 15 gunned down in ChhattisgarhSecurity forces killed 15 Maoists, including top leader Patiram Majhi alias Anal Da carrying a Rs 1 crore bounty, in an encounter in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum district.

Grap-3 curbs revoked in Delhi as AQI improvesThe Air Quality Index (AQI) of Delhi was recorded at 322 on Thursday, indicating a shift out of the "severe" category. Hence, Grap-3 curbs were revoked in Delhi.

When layoffs hit the 40s: Professionals tell their job-loss storiesCorporate professionals in their 40s are increasingly speaking out about how layoffs, age bias, AI-led restructuring, and aggressive cost-cutting are reshaping mid-career job security in India, turning what was once considered the most stable phase of a career into a period marked by uncertainty, stalled growth, and sudden exits despite decades of experience.

US less reliable now: JP Morgan CEO points to Canada's tilt towards India, ChinaJP Morgan CEO Jamie Dimon was cautious with his response to Canadian PM's Mark Carney's "rupture in world order" assessment, as he said that while America has caused certain things that may not be good for the nation in the long run, it still has not become "unreliable".

Border 2, like Dhurandhar, banned in Gulf countries over India-Pakistan themeBorder 2, set for release tomorrow, has been banned in Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, and the UAE over its perceived 'anti-Pakistan' themes. The move followed recent trends with similar Indian films based on patriotic themes in the region.

Took me to men's toilet: Korean woman molested by airport staff details ordealThe South Korean tourist, in an exclusive interview with India Today, narrated her ordeal at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport. The airport staffer has now been arrested.

sports.headline: Nikhil Naaz On Bangladesh Out Of T20 World Cup: 'Politics Is Winning This Round' On this Special Report, sports editor Nikhil Naaz discusses the official confirmation that Bangladesh will miss the upcoming T20 World Cup in India. The decision follows the ICC's rejection of the Bangladesh Cricket Board's plea for a hybrid model, leading to Scotland taking their place. Nikhil Naaz observed, 'Whatever was spoken there, I don't want to mention this. That is just between the players and us,' referring to the lack of transparency regarding the Bangladeshi government's talks with its players. The discussion highlights how political turmoil has turned a global tournament into a diplomatic flashpoint, marking the first time a team has been removed from a World Cup by the ICC. Naaz notes that while India maintains its stance as a safe host, the real losers are the cricketers whose dreams are sidelined by political standoff. The programme also touches upon the strained cricketing ties in the Asian circuit, involving Pakistan and the future of the Asia Cup.

In Quotes: Why Bangladesh decided to boycott T20 World Cup Bangladesh has decided to boycott the T20 World Cup in India due to unresolved security concerns. The BCB demands shifting the tournament matches to Sri Lanka to ensure player safety and fair participation.

Pakistan instigating Bangladesh with T20 WC snub and bring India down: Madan Lal Indian legend Madan Lal has claimed that Pakistan is instigating Bangladesh to go ahead with the T20 World Cup boycott to bring India down. The Bangladesh Cricket Board announced on Thursday, January 22, that they have decided to snub the World Cup.

Madan Lal Slams Bangladesh's 'Foolish' Decision To Boycott World Cup In India On this India Today special report, former Indian cricketer Madan Lal reacts to the Bangladesh Cricket Board's decision to boycott the upcoming World Cup in India. Madan Lal describes the move as 'foolish' and 'a stupid decision', suggesting that Bangladesh stands to lose significantly from a commercial and financial standpoint. He alleges that Pakistan is instigating Bangladesh to undermine India's position in global cricket. The discussion highlights the ICC's 14-2 vote in favour of the tournament proceeding in India, despite Bangladesh's security concerns. Madan Lal emphasizes that while the 'show will go on' with potential replacements like Scotland or Zimbabwe, the decision will severely impact the players who 'die for an opportunity to play in a World Cup'. He further warns that such political interference could have long-term repercussions for the Asian Cricket Council and the future of the game in the region.

Atul Vasan Slams Bangladesh's T20 World Cup Boycott: 'They Didn't See Through The Endgame' On this India Today special report, former Indian cricketer Atul Vasan reacts to the Bangladesh government's decision to boycott the upcoming T20 World Cup in India. Vasan criticises the move as a 'rash decision', stating, 'I think it's quite funny because they actually didn't see through the endgame'. He argues that Bangladesh has 'cut their nose to spite the face' by mixing politics with cricket over safety concerns and IPL snubs. Vasan supports the BCCI and ICC for refusing to shift matches out of India, noting that the logistical challenges would be a 'nightmare'. He further suggests that Scotland could replace Bangladesh in the tournament, dismissing the impact of potential support for the boycott from Pakistan. The discussion highlights the shift in the global cricket order and the financial influence of India in the current revenue model, concluding that Bangladesh's absence will not significantly affect the tournament's competitive nature.

Won't play in India: Bangladesh boycott T20 World Cup, ICC to name replacement The Bangladesh Cricket Board on Thursday remained firm in its stance, saying it won't play in India. The ICC, on Wednesday, rejected Bangladesh's request to change the venues, dismissing concerns of security threat for Bangladesh players in India.

Rohit Sharma conferred with honourary doctorate by Ajeenkya DY Patil University Former India captain Rohit Sharma received an honorary doctorate from Ajeenkya DY Patil University. The award recognises his leadership and significant contribution to Indian cricket.

Sunil Gavaskar jokes Abhishek Sharma hits fifty in balls he took to open his account Sunil Gavaskar joked about Abhishek Sharma after the Indian opener's scintillating knock against New Zealand during the first T20I. Abhishek scored a 35-ball 84 to get India the win in Nagpur.

Tendulkar salutes Saina Nehwal: You carried Indian badminton to the world stage Sachin Tendulkar heaped praise on Saina Nehwal's illustrious career and contributions to badminton after the Indian ace announced her retirement from the sport recently. Nehwal is a former World No.1 in the sport.

Pakistan take dig at India, new series promo asks handshake bhool gaye?The Pakistan Cricket Board's new promo for the Australia tour has sparked controversy as many interpret it as taking a dig at India and their no handshake policy. Indian teams have refused to shake hands with their Pakistan counterparts in major tournaments following the Pahalgam attacks last year.

PV Sindhu becomes first Indian to complete 500 match wins, storms into quartersIndonesia Masters 2026: PV Sindhu became only the sixth women's singles player to complete 500 match wins in her career. The Indian shuttler defeated familiar foe Line Hojmark Kjaerfeldt of Denmark to storm into the quarterfinal of the Super 500 tournament at the iconic Istora in Jakarta.

Djokovic opens up on nostalgic Melbourne fig tree ritual after Australia Open winNovak Djokovic revealed his long-held fig tree ritual in Melbourne after beating Francesco Maestrelli at the Australian Open. The Serbian said the tradition grounds him mentally as he chases history in Melbourne Park this year.

Babar Azam's Big Bash League misery ends as Pakistan batter called homeBBL 16: Pakistan batter Babar Azam ended his stint in the Big Bash League before Sydney Sixers' crucial knocked out match against Hobart Hurricanes. Babar is expected to join the senior national team as it prepares for the T20 World Cup.

Babar Azam's stint at Big Bash League: Selling the dream, delivering the dotsThe hype arrived early, but the sixes did not. Babar Azam's Big Bash stint became a masterclass in how modern T20 cricket has moved on without him.

No Gill, all thrill: India's hyper aggression returns right before T20 World CupIND vs NZ, 1st T20I: India showcased fearless, aggressive batting to pile up 238 against New Zealand in the T20I series opener in Nagpur. With Shubman Gill out of the side, India returned to their belligerent best, each batter playing without fear of failure, while Rinku Singh provided the cushion in the lower middle order.

Watch: MS Dhoni finally reacts to RCB's IPL 2025 title, leaves fans in splitsMS Dhoni acknowledged Royal Challengers Bengaluru's maiden IPL title with a straightforward, honest response. The CSK legend congratulated RCB and their fans while admitting that, as a competitor, he always wants his own team to win.

Rinku Singh underused by India, should have played 100 T20Is by now: Simon DoullIND vs NZ, 1st T20I: Rinku Singh's unbeaten 44 helped India crush New Zealand by 48 runs in Nagpur, prompting Simon Doull to call him one of the best finishers India has underutilized.

Decoding RCB's bold moves: Turning weakness into winning weapons in WPL 2026WPL 2026: RCB have won five matches on the trot and sit atop the points table. With a playoff spot already secured, their focus now shifts to holding on to the top position and booking a direct berth in the final.

Barcelona, Bayern and Liverpool return to form as UCL RO16 race tightensEurope's heavyweights responded as the Champions League playoff race intensified, with Barcelona, Bayern Munich and Liverpool returning to winning ways. Crucial victories reshaped the qualification picture as margins tightened across the league phase.

IND vs NZ: Arshdeep Singh unfazed by Playing XI pressure, enjoying one game at a timeArshdeep Singh played down any Playing XI pressure after India's dominant Nagpur win, insisting his focus remains on enjoying the game and being ready whenever called upon. The left-arm pacer reiterated that selection decisions are beyond his control as India build towards the T20 World Cup.

AUS Open Day 5 live: Sinner in cruise control, Djokovic and Swiatek go throughAustralian Open 2026 Live: Novak Djokovic set the tone on Day 5 with a commanding win over Francesco Maestrelli, followed by Iga Swiatek scripting a similarly dominant victory against Marie Bouzkova. Up next, Jannik Sinner takes centre stage against Australia's James Duckworth.

Gambhir reacts to Tharoor's PM Modi post, says pitted against his own teamIND vs NZ: India head coach Gautam Gambhir found himself in the spotlight after Shashi Tharoor publicly lauded his role ahead of the New Zealand series. Gambhir's sharp response on X has triggered a massive debate on social media.

Abhishek Sharma jokes after Nagpur carnage: I don't have a lot of shotsIND vs NZ: India opener Abhishek Sharma joked at the end of the 1st T20I that he did not have enough shots in his arsenal. Sharma said that he only had a few, and he tried to execute them well.

Bangladesh to decide on T20 World Cup participation after meeting cricketersThe Bangladesh government will take a call on T20 World Cup participation in a cabinet meeting on Thursday, January 22. The sports advisor will also meet the cricketers and take their opinion on participation in the World Cup.

India crush New Zealand in Nagpur, begin final T20 World Cup preps in styleIND vs NZ, 1st T20I: Suryakumar Yadav's India took a 1-0 lead in the five-match series after hammering New Zealand by 48 runs at the VCA Stadium in Nagpur. Abhishek Sharma was the star performer for the hosts with 84 runs off 35 balls.

Suryakumar Yadav shows signs of form, becomes 3rd fastest Indian to 9000 T20 runsIND vs NZ, 1st T20I: Suryakumar Yadav showed signs of returning to form, becoming the third-fastest Indian to 9,000 T20 runs with a fluent 32 off 22 balls against New Zealand on Wednesday in Nagpur.

Abhishek Sharma dazzles Nagpur with 35-ball 84, completes 5000 T20 runsStar India opener Abhishek Sharma lit up Nagpur with a blazing 35-ball 84 in the first T20I against New Zealand on Wednesday and became the fourth-fastest Indian batter to cross 5000 runs in T20 cricket.

Didn't stop Rohit Sharma for selfie: Woman explains shocking security breach in IndoreA woman breached security at the Indian team hotel in Indore on Sunday in an attempt to meet Rohit Sharma following India's ODI series against New Zealand. She later revealed that her actions were driven by a desperate effort to draw the Indian cricketer's attention and seek help for her ailing daughter.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
